elements.title: statue of an apple (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there is a 7.5-metre-tall (25 ft) statue of an apple (pictured) in Waitomo, New Zealand?

elements.title: Julian Hill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julian Hill was the first player from Campbell University to make an NFL roster, but Brevin Allen was the first to play in a game?

elements.title: a video game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a freelance game developer successfully pitched a video game with a picture of a car driving around a lake?

elements.title: Valerie Cowie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Valerie Cowie was appointed a senior lecturer, one of her referees wrote that his "only reservation is that the post ... does not adequately do justice to her high academic status"?

elements.title: Museum of Norwich at the Bridewell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Museum of Norwich at the Bridewell operated as a residence, a house of correction, a factory, and finally a museum?

elements.title: Charlotte Haining (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Charlotte Haining was an International Jury Member for the selection of Finland's 2020 Eurovision Song Contest entry?

elements.title: a Maine TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Maine TV station was so protective of its evening newscast that it preempted nearly 40 percent of all NBC Sports programming in 1994?

elements.title: Hạc San (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hồn – trăng – máu, Hạc San's concept album, consists solely of the 29-minute title track?
